news.title: Ireland back in Trump’s crosshairs as he promises ‘substantial tariffs’ on countries who ‘attack’ American tech companies
news.summary: US president Donald Trump has said he will impose "substantial additional tariffs” on countries regulating American big tech firms, in a move that could have implications for Ireland.

news.title: Sales of €1m-plus homes soar across Ireland as US buyers swoop in
news.summary: Sales of €1m-plus luxury homes across Ireland have surged dramatically amid ongoing supply shortages, continued demand, increasing prices and the ­impact of overseas buyers.

news.title: Hundreds demand Government block Central Bank’s role in Israeli ‘war bond’ sale
news.summary: A pro-Palestine protest has been held outside government departments over the Central Bank of Ireland’s role in approving Israel Bonds for sale in the EU which they say are funding the war in Gaza.

news.title: ‘We are heartbroken’ – Tipperary community devastated at death of popular teen at Belfast music festival
news.summary: Tributes have been paid to the Tipperary teenager who died after becoming ill at a music festival in Belfast.

news.title: Jack O’Connor confirmed as Kerry football manager for another two years
news.summary: Jack O’Connor's re-appointment for another two-year term as manager of the Kerry senior football team was ratified without fanfare at Tuesday night's county committee meeting.

news.title: Taylor Swift announces engagement to NFL star Travis Kelce
news.summary: Singer Taylor Swift has announced her engagement to NFL star Travis Kelce.

news.title: Young man remains in critical condition following alleged assault in Co Mayo last weekend
news.summary: A young man remains in a critical condition in Beaumont Hospital in Dublin following an alleged assault in Castlebar, Co Mayo, last weekend.

news.title: Darragh McCullough: From losing €600 a week to outgrowing the cart – the coffee gamble that paid off
news.summary: It's harvest time, the fields are a riot, autumn planting is looming, and what am I doing? Fretting about a bloody coffee shop that's spiralling out of control. Although, calling it a shop might be a bit of an exaggeration, given that it is, in fact, a tarted-up horsebox I found on Done Deal.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Jim Gavin is a proven winner on big stage but Billy Kelleher is a disruptor in Fianna Fáil presidency saga
news.summary: Jim McGuinness is the only manager to have beaten Jim Gavin in the All-Ireland football championship.

news.title: Chrissie Russell: The strange comfort of mocking Donald Trump and Kim Kardashian’s tasteless decor
news.summary: There’s obviously an argument to be made that ‘offences against interior design’ isn’t exactly going to top the list of grievances that could be levelled against the current US president. But nevertheless, have you seen the state of the White House lately?
